intro: Zygophyllum crassifolium, commonly known as the thick-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its dense, fleshy leaves that help conserve water in hot, dry environments. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland ecosystems. Zygophyllum crassifolium is well adapted to harsh conditions, making it a resilient component of its native habitat.
